reviews.sentence: First Visit to the Windy City. My husband and I went on a weekend trip to Chicago to see one of our favorite bands Sister Hazel. As a Hilton Honor Member he found a great deal for the Doubletree. It is just a couple blocks off Michigan Avenue close to the lake. The hotel was clean and the staff was helpful and friendly. We loved the experience and walked everywhere. Christmas time in Chicago was a wonderful time.

Nice weekend getaway. Great hotel for a over nite or week long trip. Very clean overall very friendly staff. Located close to the Magnificent Mile but not right on it. Only disappointed about the lake view room is not much of a lake view with a building being remodeled across the street that took the sight line to the lake now you can only see a sliver between buildings safe your money and get a standard room.

The location. that is iti paid for a Lakefront view room. It had no microwave. no fridgeexcept for the expensive fridge that holds the drinks that cost an arm and a leg and no lake view just a bunch of buildings. I am highly disappointed and will never return.

Parking prices are terrible at the hotel. There should be an incentive to park at the hotel so the guest do not have to walk for a better price. Front desk staff was very friendly. I upgraded and. Requested a lake view. The view was AWFUL.
LIAR HOTEL STUFF. NO LAKE VIEW DONT LIE TOPEOPLE LAKE VIEW I PAID EXTRA FOR LAKE VIEW LIAR THIEFT PEOPLE.

February 6 8th 2015. There was 3 of us traveling for leisure and we stayed on the 26th floor with a city view. Luckily I did not pay for the view because I was not impressed with the view. The 500 daily fee for parking was too expensive and just ridiculous. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable. The hotel staff was very helpful with helping me with some great suggestions for places to visit during our trip. I would stay here again but I will request a lake view next time.

Located central downtown. Payed extra for a lake view. was not a lake view but rather a little s Liver of water between buildings. leak in the ceiling dripping water guide function on TV did not work. hallways dirty no room service in the morn chrg for WiFi Mini bar crazy expensive 60 for a small bottle of water.

Located central downtown. Payed extra for a lake view. was not a lake view but rather a little s Liver of water between buildings. leak in the ceiling dripping water guide function on TV did not work. hallways dirty no room service in the morn chrg for WiFi Mini bar crazy expensive 60 for a small bottle of water.

Love it. This hotel is great. love the location. It is close to the attraction like the navy pair Michigan avenue Chicago River Milinume Park. The only thing you should be aware of is the lake view is partly from the lake view rooms and it is not worth paying extra money for it.

Good choice in the heart of Chicago. Great location comfortable beds clean room. Hope to come back some dayWe booked room with a lake viewbut the view was very limited because of the building in front. The young man at the front desk on our check in day should have been more polite.

Great location. Great location to Michigan avenue and easy access to Lake Shore Drive. Convenient location to all major points in downtown Chicago. It costs 50 parking overnight in the parking structure next to the hotel which is very expensive.

Average Hotel with a Great Location Outdoor Pool. Stayed there recently over the Memorial Day Holiday. Hotel was very crowded with great check in service upon arrival. do not forget your warm chocolate chip cookie. The Hotel is located close to the Mag Mile Restaurants Lake Shore Drive Navy Pier and so many other main attractions. Rooms are clean with comfortable beds however they are also a dated. Lobby area has a small bar lots of other choices near by. The Hotel also has a Restaurant. Overall nice family hotel with an excellent Location. Remember you are in Chicago to many main attractions to spend money on a 4 5 star hotel you will not be in your room until sleepy time. Enjoy your stay.

Prime location in the Windy City. The hotel is close to the Mag mile with shops and restaurants. The room was nicely decorated and comfortable with a view of Lake Michigan which was nice. Bed was incredible great nights sleep.

Birthday Surprise. While checking in my 5 year old daughter was asked if she was celebrating anything during her stay. She told them that is her birthday the next day. They continued discussing our plans and the staff member asked her about her doll she was carrying. We checked in and our room was very nice on a high floor with a great view of the lake and the pool. After a few hours on Navy Pier which was a short walk away we returned to our room to find a note with cold milk a tin of cookies and chocolate covered strawberries. The note said to have a happy birthday and let them know if we needed anything it was addressed to my daughter and also mentioned her DOLL by name. This was a wonderful birthday surprise. I called home to see if my husband had set it up but it was really all from the front desk staff. Hours later when our room service was delivered this employee also wished my daughter a happy birthday for the next day AND as we were checking at the next day employees asked about her big day. I was not happy at first with the high room rate it was sold out weekend downtown. but this fantastic service caused me to give an excellent review and we will try and stay there in there again in the future.

Nice Rooms Good Location Great Price. We got a great deal on this hotel through Honors. In addition we were upgraded to a corner room upon arrival which gave us a walk in closet bathroom with a shower and full tub and a great view of the lake and city. The receptionist that helped us was very nice. A couple of tips 1. There is a Whole Foods diagonal to the hotel. We ate breakfast here and stopped by on a couple of occasions to get water and drinks. This was very helpful. 2. There is a bike rental within one block toward Michigan ave that you can rent a bike for 10 for a 24 hour period. This was very helpful instead of using Lyft3. We flew into Midway 3 per person and got off at Lake State and took a Lyft to the hotel total6 ride. This was convenient and easy4. Sign up for Lyft if you have not used it before. They will give you 20 in free ride credits and there are tons of drivers in the city and it is WAY cheaper than taking a cab. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good location at a great price.

Good hotel for a low price. Only a few minute walk to the Magnificent Mile. Hotel staff were pleasant and accommodating and gave us cookies when we checked in. At times the elevators ran quite slow. The room itself was alright. It was clean but the furniture was showing its age and could use some work. The window in the room constantly had condensation on it so we could not see the city and had to be careful where we put our bags. The hotel was quiet at night so I always slept peacefully which was phenomenal. A little bummed that there was not a continental breakfast but what can you do. How close it was to the Magnificent Mile without the crazy price. The restaurant Burrito Beach was definitely worth the walk around the corner. Figure out why the windows constantly have condensation before it can cause serious damage to the building or a guests belongings.

Good price great location. Compared to other expensive choices in the area I loved this option. 3 blocks from the lake makes for good exercise location. Near Michigan Ave and lots of food options. I would definitely stay here again.

Very friendly and accommodating staff. We were traveling with a toddler and they fulfilled every request we had. Best thing about this hotel is the location. Very short walk to Navy Pier and Ohio Street Beach.

Stayed for a weekend after Christmas and had a great time. Hotel was in a perfect location if you are not afraid of walking. Walked to the beach and then Navy Pier. Headed to Millennium Park back to the hotel before going shopping. It was a good 7 miles in a day but well worth all the sites you get to see. Plus warm cookies from the front desk is always a plus.
very close to beautiful beach and to navy pier. staff is very helpful and friendly.
